they go in ~/.fluxbox/styles
and how can i access this folder ?
open a terminal and type  cd ~/.fluxbox/styles  or open it in nautilus
you'll need to get nautilus to show hidden files and folders somehow

how can i select a style i'v put in ?
if you right click on your desktop to get the fluxbox menu up, then select fluxbox menu, and then user styles
when i click right @ my desktop when i'm running fluxbox, there's nothing :/
the folder will need to be .fluxbox/styles - the . is important, the folder should already exist anyway

have you managed to untar whatever you've downloaded?
sure :p
cool sorry, if i remember correctly there'll be a folder called styles and wallpapers in your download, just copy the contents of styles to ~/.fluxbox/styles and wallpapers to ~/.fluxbox/wallpapers
whats the terminal command for that ?
go into the directory containing your download, cp styles/* ~/.fluxbox/styles/ && cp wallpapers/* ~/.fluxbox/wallpapers/

really, i think it's perhaps best to get yourself familiar with the terminal before trying to use fluxbox, else you won't get much done =P
